bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Memorandum from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, November 17, 1948

div1.p: Kean identifies people in a photograph of Lee's staff, from 1899. He cannot find some of his own papers and photographs that would help him with the identification.

div1.head: Memorandum from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, November 17, 1948
div1.p:
Ac
R
Gen Fitzhugh Lee & Staff-
2804 N STREET N. W.
WASHINGTON 7. D. C.
Havana Cuba
Jan ? 1899-

list.item:
1. Dr. George Fowler Major Ch. Surg
U. S. Vols
2. Col. Wm R. Livermore U. S. Eng-

3. Col. Louis M. Maus Chief Surgeon
VII Army Corps

4 Major R. E Lee Michie us, cav
Asst. Adjutant Gen. Chief of Staff
A very fine and able man-
was Brig Gen in World War I & Reed
in France
5. Maj. Gen Fitzhugh Lee Comdg VII A. C.
6 Face familiar but do not recall name
8 Lt. Col O. E. Wood Chief Commissary

9 I think this is Lt Col Curtis Guild of
Boston

12. Major Russell Harrison U. S. V, son of President
H-

13 Lieut Sartoris Vol. Eug. } Aides to
}Gen Lee-

div1.p:
J. R. Kean
Washington 7. D C
17 Nov. 1948-

Gen. Truby is in error in thinking the no 1
is I. I never had that much stomach, and
besides I was not on Lee's staff at that
time- I came to Cuba as Major USV and
Chief Surgeon 1st Div. VII Army Corps- I succeeded
Col. Maus when he went back to U. S. the next
year & had rank of Lt. Col for several months only-
until the Corps was mustered out-

I have a bundle of papers & some photos of the
VII Army Corps but have not been able to
find them- With these I could find names
of all these men I think with duties-

My memory for names is much worse since my
illness at Walter Reed Hospital last spring, tho
I can remember facts pretty well-
Col Maus was relieved as Ch. Surg VII A. C.
Feb. 6 1899-
I took the office Feb. 11th 1899
